name: emi.unicore-tsi
description: The TSI is one point where UNICORE’s seamless model meets local variations and so will need to be adapted to the target system. The TSI is a Perl script (requires Version 5.004 or later). If you must use a previous version of Perl, then you should read and change the first few lines of the "tsi" file. The TSI performs the work on behalf of UNICORE users and so must be able to execute processes under different uids and gids. Therefore, in production it must be run with sufficient privileges to allow this (during development and test it can be run as a normal user).
releaseNotes:
What's new



There are the following fixes:



    * Submit.pm: handle TSI_STDERR and TSI_STDOUT sent from XNJS for redirecting output and error

    * fix: Torque: GetStatusListing.pm now handles non-word characters in queue name

    * updated the manual 



And two enhancements



    * tsi_ls is returning more information on files: owner, owning group, full UNIX permissions

    * new module ACL.pm for getting/setting filesystem ACL 



Upgrade/deployment notes



    * No special notes on clean deployment.

    * Upgrading: the rpm does yet fully support upgrading. We recommend making a backup of the /etc/unicore/tsi/* files, and installing from scratch, i.e. erasing unicore-tsi first and then re-installing.



Known Issues



None.
